Plots:
import plotly.express as px
sub_category_sales = df.groupby('Sub-Category')['Sales'].sum().reset_index()
top_10_sub_categories = sub_category_sales.sort_values('Sales', ascending=False).head(10)
fig = px.bar(top_10_sub_categories, x='Sub-Category', y='Sales', color='Sub-Category', title='Top 10 Sub-Categories by Sales', category_orders={'Sub-Category': top_10_sub_categories['Sub-Category'].tolist()})
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
df['Order Date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['Order Date'])
df['Year'] = df['Order Date'].dt.year
df['Month'] = df['Order Date'].dt.month
monthly_sales = df.groupby(['Year', 'Month'])['Sales'].sum().reset_index()
fig = px.line(monthly_sales, x='Month', y='Sales', color='Year', title='Monthly Sales Trend', labels={'Month': 'Month', 'Sales': 'Sales', 'Year': 'Year'}, color_discrete_sequence=px.colors.qualitative.Set1)
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.pie(df, names='Ship Mode', color='Ship Mode', color_discrete_map={'Second Class': 'blue', 'Standard Class': 'green', 'First Class': 'red', 'Same Day': 'yellow'})
fig.update_layout(title_text='Shipping Mode Distribution', title_x=0.5, title_font=dict(size=24, color='black'))
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.scatter(df, x='Customer ID', y='Sales', color='Customer ID', title='Customer ID vs Sales', color_discrete_sequence=px.colors.qualitative.Antique)
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.bar(df.sort_values(by='Profit', ascending=False).head(10), x='Product Name', y='Profit', color_discrete_sequence=['blue', 'green', 'red', 'orange', 'purple', 'yellow', 'pink', 'brown', 'gray', 'black'], title='Product Name vs Profit', labels={'Product Name': 'Product Name', 'Profit': 'Profit'})
fig.update_layout(xaxis=dict(tickvals=df.sort_values(by='Profit', ascending=False).head(10)['Product Name'], ticktext=df.sort_values(by='Profit', ascending=False).head(10)['Product Name']))
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.scatter(df, x='Order Date', y='Ship Date', color='Order Date', title='Order Date vs Ship Date', labels={'Order Date': 'Order Date', 'Ship Date': 'Ship Date'})
fig.update_layout(xaxis=dict(tickvals=df['Order Date'].unique()), yaxis=dict(tickvals=df['Ship Date'].unique()))
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
top_products = df.groupby('Product Name')['Quantity'].sum().reset_index()
top_products = top_products.nlargest(10, 'Quantity')
fig = px.bar(top_products, x='Product Name', y='Quantity', color='Category', title='Top 10 Products by Sales Quantity', color_discrete_map={'Furniture': 'lightblue', 'Office Supplies': 'orange', 'Technology': 'green'})
fig.update_layout(xaxis=dict(tickangle=-45), yaxis=dict(tickformat='.0f'), legend=dict(title='Category', orientation='h', y=1.02))
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.scatter(df, x='Discount', y='Profit', color='Discount', title='Discount vs Profit', labels={'Discount': 'Discount Percentage', 'Profit': 'Profit Amount'}, category_orders={'Discount': ['0.0', '0.1', '0.2', '0.3', '0.4', '0.45']}, color_continuous_scale='Viridis')
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
customer_order_count = df.groupby('Customer ID')['Order ID'].count().reset_index()
customer_order_count = customer_order_count.sort_values('Order ID', ascending=False)
fig = px.bar(customer_order_count, x='Customer ID', y='Order ID', color_discrete_sequence=px.colors.diverging.Tealrose)
fig.update_layout(title='Customer ID vs Order Count', xaxis_title='Customer ID', yaxis_title='Order Count')
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.bar(df, x='Sub-Category', y='Sales', color='Sub-Category', barmode='group', title='Sub-Category vs Average Sales', color_discrete_sequence=px.colors.qualitative.Antique)
fig.update_xaxes(tickangle=-45)
fig.to_json()

import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
df['Order Date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['Order Date'])
sales_by_date = df.groupby('Order Date')['Sales'].sum().reset_index()
fig = px.line(sales_by_date, x='Order Date', y='Sales', title='Order Date vs Sales', color_discrete_sequence=['indigo'])
peak_days = sales_by_date.nlargest(5, 'Sales')
fig.add_scatter(x=peak_days['Order Date'], y=peak_days['Sales'], mode='markers', marker=dict(size=10, color='red'), name='Peak Sales Days')
fig.update_layout(xaxis=dict(tickformat='%Y-%m-%d'), yaxis=dict(tickformat=',.0f'))
fig.to_json()
